member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.MultiModesGripPE
member.summary: When implemented and registered as a protocol extension to an Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity-derived class, this protocol extension interface specifies the communication with the grip editing complex for information on what alternatives can be provided to stretching grip points.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.MultiModesGripPE.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.MultiModesGripPE.GetGripModes(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GripData,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GripModeCollection,System.UInt32&)
member.summary: Queries an object, on a given grip point, for the available modes it provides. It also returns the current mode identifier.
member.param: The Entity whose modes are requested. The object needs to be open at least for read.
The grip whose modes are requested.
The returned collection of available modes.
The returned identifier of current mode.

member.summary: Gets the current mode identifier.
member.param: The Entity whose current mode id is requested.
The grip whose mode id is requested.

The grip whose mode is requested.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.MultiModesGripPE.SetCurrentMode(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GripData,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the current mode.
member.param: The Entity whose current mode is to be set current.
The grip whose current mode is to be set current.
The numerical identifier for the new current mode.

member.summary: Gets the grip type of a given grip.
member.param: The Entity whose grip type is requested.
The grip whose grip type is requested.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.MultiModesGripPE.Reset(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity)
member.summary: Resets the current mode to default (up to each concrete class to establish what the default is).
member.param: The Entity whose current mode is reset to default.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase
member.summary: AssocDimDependencyBodyBase ties together the following objects that define a dimensional constraint:

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.UpdateDependentOnObjectOverride
member.summary: This method needs to be overriden and implemented by derived classes. It updates the controlled entity position, size and orientation. The base class implementation just handles reference dimensions that are not dimensional constraints. This method updates the corresponding AssocVariable with the current measured value of the dimension and updates the entity text with the current measurement.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.Constraint
member.summary: Returns the corresponding dimensional constraint node.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetSubentityGeoms(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Returns all constrained subentities of Entities constrained by this dimensional constraint.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetVariableNameAndExpression(System.String&,System.String&,System.String)
member.summary: Returns name, expression and current value of the AssocVariable that corresponds to this dimensional constraint.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetEntityNameAndExpression(System.String&,System.String&)
member.summary: Returns name and expression from the text that the managed entity is displaying.
member.param: Name from the managed entity display text.
Expression from the managed entity display text.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SetVariableNameAndExpression(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets new name and expression of the AssocVariable that corresponds to this dimensional constraint. Either name or expression may be empty strings which indicates no change.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SetEntityNameAndExpression(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets name and expression that the managed entity should display. Either name or expression may be empty strings which indicates not to change them.
member.param: New name the managed entity should display.
New expression the managed entity should display.
New value the managed entity should display.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SetNameAndExpression(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets name and expression on both the AssocVariable that corresponds to this dimensional constraint and on the managed entity that serves as the graphical representation of this dimensional constraint. Either name or expression may be empty strings which indicates no change.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.ValidateEntityText(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given entityTextToValidate can be used as the text the managed entity displays. Either the name or the expression part of the entityTextToValidate text may be empty which means that the current name/expression should be used.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.ComposeEntityText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Composes the text that the managed entity should display. The text is composed from the corresponding AssocVariable name, expression and/or value. The text formatting follows requiredNameFormat.
member.param: The constraint name format display, deafault value if -1. If requiredNameFormat == -1, CONSTRAINTNAMEFORMAT sysvar is used for choosing the text format.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SetVariableValueToMeasuredValue
member.summary: Measures the current dimensional constraint based on the current positions and sizes of the constrained geometries and sets the corresponding AssocVariable to this measured value. If the dimensional constraint is satisfied, the AssocVariable value will already be equal to the measured value and no setting is needed, and nothing happens. Notice that if AssocVariable contained an expression, it will be erased and the variable will just contain a numerical value, not an expression.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.DeactivateConstraint
member.summary: Deactivates the constraint.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.ReactivateConstraint
member.summary: Reactivates the constraint. Reactivating a constraint means creating a d_node or r_node for this ExplicitConstraint and adding it to the DCM dimension system.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetFromEntity(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId)
member.summary: Gets the AssocDimDependencyBodyBase from the dependent-on Entity, such as from the AcDbDimension it controls. If the entity does not have an AssocDimDependencyBodyBase attached, ObjectId.Null is returned.
member.param: The entity id of the dependent-on Entity, such as of an Dimension.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.EntityAttachmentPointMoved(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SubentityGeometry[],System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the constraint geometry when dimension grip points are moved. Any move made through triangular grip should move the constraint geometry by the same amount and update the constraint variable value. Clients of this function need to pass new positions of the dimension attachment in SubentGeometry array, and new dimension measurement. This API performs the following operations:.
member.param: The new attached geometries to be updated.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.EvaluateOverride
member.summary: This function sets the name and expression in the controlled entity text to be the same as the name and expression of the corresponding AssocVariable.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.ModifiedOverride(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject)
member.summary: If the controlled entity text changed, this function sets the name and expression of the AssocVariable to be the same as the name and expression in the entity text.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.ErasedOverride(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When the dependent-on object (such as an Dimension) is erased, the corresponding AssocVariable is also erased.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SubErase(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overridden method from the DBObject base class. It erases the controlled entity, such as the Dimension.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.FormatToCurrentPrecision(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Formats the given expression to current precision.
member.param: Indicates it is an angular constraint.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SetEraseDimensionIfDependencyIsErased(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Under normal circumstances the controlled Dimension object is erased if the AssocDimDependencyBodyBase is erased. This static method allows this behaviorto be suppressed, i.e., not erasing the Dimension if the AssocDimDependencyBodyBase is erased. This can be useful for the creation of reference constraints since the same dimension should be retained and used for a reference constraint later on.
member.param: Indicates to suppress the erase behavior or not.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetEraseDimensionIfDependencyIsErased
member.summary: Under normal circumstances an associated Dimension object is erased if the AssocDimDependencyBodyBase is erased. This static method returns true iff this behavior is suppressed , i.e. not erasing the Dimension if the AssocDimDependencyBodyBase is erased.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.EntityTextOverride
member.summary: Derived classes needs to override this pure virtual property. This is how they provide the text of the entity they manage.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.EntityMeasurementOverride
member.summary: Derived classes needs to override this pure virtual read only property to provide the current measurement of the entity they manage.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.IsEntityAttachmentChangedOverride
member.summary: Derived classes need to override this pure virtual read only property to inform whether the attachment of the entity they manage changed, such as whether the entity has been repositioned.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.Variable
member.summary: Gets the object id of the corresponding AssocVariable.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.ConstrainedGeoms
member.summary: Gets all ConstrainedGeometries constrained by this dimensional constraint.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.SubentityConstrainedGeoms
member.summary: Gets all constrained subentities of Entities constrained by this dimensional constraint.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.IsConstraintActive
member.summary: Indicates whether the constraint is active.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetMeasuredValue
member.summary: Gets the current dimensional constraint based on the current positions and sizes of the constrained geometries. If the dimensional constraint is satisfied, the AssocVariable value will already be equal to the measured value.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.IsReferenceOnly
member.summary: Sets whether the constraint is reference only. A reference "constraint" keeps updating its AssocVariable and the dimension text with the measured value of the dimension, but it does not function as a dimensional constraint.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.GetCurrentlyUsedEntityNameFormat
member.summary: Gets the format that is used to display the entity name and expression by looking at the currently displayed entity text. See CONSTRAINTNAMEFORMAT sysvar for the possible format values.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDimDependencyBodyBase.IsRelevantChangeOverride
member.summary: Overridden property from AssocDependencyBody base class.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocValueProviderPE
member.summary: AcRx protocol extension pure virtual base class that defines protocol to get and set arbitrary simple scalar values of DBObjects. The values are identified by string names (needed if there is more than one of them for the same object) and their meaning is up to the implementor of the concrete protocol extension derived classes.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocValueProviderPE.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocValueProviderPE.CanGetValue(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether it is possible to get the value identified by valueName. The default implementation always returns true for any valueName.
member.param: The name of the queried value.
The object must be open for read.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocValueProviderPE.CanSetValue(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether it is possible to set the value identified by valueName. The default implementation always returns false for any valueName.
member.param: The name of the queried value.
The object must be open for read.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocValueProviderPE.GetValue(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value identified by valueName. This method must always be overridden by concrete derived classes.
member.param: The name of the queried value.
The object must be open for read.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocValueProviderPE.SetValue(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,System.String,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ResultBuffer)
member.summary: Sets the value identified by valueName.
member.param: The name of the value to be set.
The object must be open for write.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDependencyPE
member.summary: Wrapper AcRx protocol extension base class that allows objects and entities to control whether they allow AssocDependencies to be attached to them. When there is no protocol extension for the object's class, it means that the object allows both read and write-type dependencies.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocDependencyPE.AllowsDependencies(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This predicate allows objects and entities to control whether they allow AssocDependencies to be attached to them. Returns true if the object allows AssocDependencies to be attached to it.
member.param: The dependency will also modify the object.
The queried object, must be open for read.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityIdPE.GetAllSubentities(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SubentityType)
member.summary: Gets all subentities of the given type. The default implementation just returns NotImplementedYet.
member.param: The entity must be open for read.
The required type of the subentities.

member.summary: Gets the vertex SubentityIds corresponding to the given edge SubentityId. This protocol is needed to query the relations between the edge and vertex subentities. The default implementation just returns NotImplementedYet.
member.param: The entity must be open for read.
Edge SubentityId whose vertex SubentityIds are to be obtained.
Returned SubentityId of the start vertex of the edge (or NullSubentityId if there is not any).
Returned SubentityId of the end vertex of the edge (or NullSubentityId if there is not any).
Returned other SubentityIds associated with the edge, such as the circle or arc center, spline control and fit points, etc.

member.summary: Gets the vertex SubentityIds corresponding to the given edge SubentityId whose geometry is defined by a spline. This protocol is needed to query the relations between the edge and vertex subentities. The default implementation just returns NotImplementedYet.
member.param: The entity must be open for read.
Edge SubentId whose vertex SubentityIds are to be obtained.
Returned SubentityId of the start vertex of the edge (or NullSubentityId if there is not any).
Returned SubentityId of the end vertex of the edge (or NullSubentityId if there is not any).
Returned SubentityIds identifying the spline control points. The order is the same as the order of the spline control points.
Returned SubentityIds identifying the spline fit points (if any). The order is the same as the order of the spline fit points.

member.param: The entity must be open for read.
Vertex SubentityId whose position is to be obtained.

member.summary: Change the geometry of a vertex subentity. The subentity can also be transformed, but for doing so there already is Entity protocol so no protocol extension is needed. The default implementation just returns NotImplementedYet.

member.summary: Mirrors the given AssocPersSubentityId, i.e., it changes it so that it identifies the same subentity in the mirrored entity as it identified before the entity is mirrored. It is called from the default implementation of the AssocPersSubentityId.Mirror() method.

The AssocPersSubentityId to be changed to reflect the fact that the entity has been mirrored.

New transformation matrix of the rigid set entity.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId
member.summary: Abstract base class used to persistently identify an SubentityId of an Entity. Unlike SubentityId that is transient and may change when the entity is modified, reevaluated, or similar, the AssocPersSubentityId identifies the subentity in such a way that it is always possible to obtain the corresponding subentities (if they still exist), even after the entity has been edited or reevaluated any number of times.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.param: The entity needs to be open for read.

member.summary: Returns the type of the subentity.
member.param: The entity needs to be open for read.

member.summary: Returns the number of transient SubentityIds corresponding to this AssocPersSubentityId. The default implementation just calls GetTransientSubentIds() and returns their count which usually is 1.
member.param: The entity needs to be open for read.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId.IsEqualTo(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId)
member.summary: Returns true if this and the other AssocPersSubentityId reference are exactly the same subentity of the same entity. The base class implementation just checks whether the classes of this and of the other AssocPersSubentityId are identical.
member.param: The entity owning the subentities of this and the other AssocPersSubentityId.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId.Mirror(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Entity)
member.summary: Notifies this AssocPersSubentityId that the entity has been mirrored and that the AssocPersSubentityId may possibly need to update itself to identify the same subentity in the mirrored entity as it identified before the entity has been mirrored.
member.param: The entity that has been mirrored. It needs to be open for read.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId.CreateObjectAndDwgInFields(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Database,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DwgFiler,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId&)
member.summary: A static method that reads the class identification of the actual AssocPersSubentityId-derived class, creates an object of this derived class and calls DwgInFields() on it.
member.param: AcDbDatabase that is going to own the AcDbAssocPersSubentId.
The filer to read the data from. The first data is the class identification.

This is an in/out argument used to return the created and filled-in object of an AssocPersSubentityId-derived class. If the createdPersSubentId is passed in as not NULL, the code tries to reuse the existing object, if it is of the expected derived class. If it is passed in as NULL or is not of the expected derived type, it creates a new object (deleting the existing one, if any).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId.CreateObjectAndDxfInFields(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DxfFiler,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocPersSubentityId&)
member.summary: A static method that reads the class identification of the actual AssocPersSubentityId-derived class, creates an object of this derived class and calls DxfInFields() on it.
member.param: The filer to read the data from. The first data is the class identification.

This is an in/out argument used to return the created and filled-in object of an AssocPersSubentityId-derived class. If the createdPersSubentId is passed in as not NULL, the code tries to reuse the existing object, if it is of the expected derived class. If it is passed in as NULL or is not of the expected derived type, it creates a new object (deleting the existing one, if any).

member.param: The filer to write the object data to.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DimensionStyleOverrule
member.summary: This .NET class wraps ObjectARX class AcDbDimensionStyleOverrule. it overrules a subset of dimension style related operations that Dimension (AcDbDimension) class specifies. It is intended as a base class for clients who want to alter some or all behavior of a given AcDbDimension-derived class. At the base level, each default implementation simply calls the corresponding method in the target class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Glyph.SetLocation(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: This method is invoked from a host application immediately prior to invoking ViewportDraw() or WorldDraw() on the glyph. The glyph should be drawn with viewport-specific graphics, typically using the device coordinate members (denoted with dc in their names) of ViewportGeometry, however the location of the position to draw them at is computed as a WCS point, since GetOsnapPoints(), GetOsnapCurves() and GetOsnapInfo() all return their points and lines in WCS coordinates.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport
member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcGiViewport ObjectARX class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.DoPerspective(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Transforms value from eye coordinates to display coordinates.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.DoInversePerspective(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Transforms value from display coordinates to eye coordinates and returns the object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.GetNumPixelsInUnitSquare(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: In perspective mode, the WCS unit square gets smaller and encompasses fewer pixels as it recedes away from the camera, whereas in non-perspective mode, the unit square stays the same size no matter how far away from the camera. So, if perspective mode is on in the viewport, then givenWorldPoint is used as the center of the unit square so that the distance from the camera to the point will be reflected in the pixel values. If perspective mode is not on, then givenWorldPoint is not used, since location has no effect on pixel count.
member.param: Input WCS point for the center point of the display coordinate unit square

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.LayerVisible(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId)
member.summary: Returns true if the layer is not frozen in this viewport and not globally frozen. Indicating that geometry on this layer should be regenerated.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.ModelToEyeTransform
member.summary: Transforms matrix to the current Model Coordinate to eye coordinate.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.EyeToModelTransform
member.summary: Returns the transformation matrix to the current eye coordinate to Model Coordinate transformation matrix.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.WorldToEyeTransform
member.summary: Transforms matrix to the current World Coordinate to eye coordinate transformation matrix.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.EyeToWorldTransform
member.summary: Returns the transformation matrix to the current eye coordinate to Model Coordinate transformation matrix.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.IsPerspective
member.summary: Returns true if perspective mode is in effect. Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.CameraLocation
member.summary: Returns camera location to the viewport camera's world coordinate location. This is where the viewport's "eye" would be in world space.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.CameraTarget
member.summary: Returns the camera target location point to the viewport camera's world coordinate target. This is a point where the viewport's "eye" is aimed in world space.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.CameraUpVector
member.summary: Returns the camera "up" direction vector to the viewport camera's world coordinate "up" vector. This is the world space vector reference that the viewport's "eye" aligns itself with.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.ViewportId
member.summary: Returns the viewport ID. This is an AcGi-specific ID that has no relation to the AutoCAD CVPORT system variable. This ID is used by the ViewportDraw.isValidId() function to determine if a viewport is still valid.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.AcadWindowId
member.summary: Returns the Viewport index number of the viewport being drawn to. This is the same index that the AutoCAD CVPORT system variable works with. So, if the viewport being drawn to is the current viewport in AutoCAD, then the value reported by the CVPORT system variable will match the value returned by this function.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.DeviceContextViewportCorners
member.summary: It positions the geometry (such as icons) that remain in a fixed position or fixed size in the viewport's display.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.FrontAndBackClipping
member.summary: Fills in the parameters with information about the existence and location of front and back display clipping planes. Clipping planes are always perpendicular to the camera target vector. When active, the geometry in front of the front clipping plane or in back of the back clipping plane is not displayed.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.LinetypeScaleMultiplier
member.summary: This is a value supplied by the viewport itself. It is an additional multiplier that is used affecting all linetypes displayed in this viewport.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.LinetypeGenerationCriteria
member.summary: During linetype elaboration of ever smaller objects, a point is reached where the dashes are so small as to be indistinguishable from a continuous line. The viewport defines a value which is used to determine whether or not further linetyping should be carried out for a given object.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.ViewDirection
member.summary: Returns the current view direction of the viewport. This value can be calculated from the target and camera points in WCS:.

member.summary: If this drawable is a block and has Attributes, it must call this method exactly once before sending the attributes to Draw(). Once this function is called, the object may draw only attributes and no more primitives. The attributes must be the last objects rendered.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.FillType
member.summary: Returns the FillType currently set in the SubEntityTraits object.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.LineWeight
member.summary: Returns the lineweight as defined by the enum LineWeight.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.LineTypeScale
member.summary: The scaling factor of linetype can be varied by this trait. A value of 1.0 is the standard scaling, 2.0 will cause the linetype dashes to be twice as long and a value of 0.5 will reduce them to half their normal length.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.Thickness
member.summary: Thickness is an extrusion in WCS units along the positive Z axis. The extrusion vector is calculated as (Z*dthickness) * modelTransform. It only affects selected primitives: as pline, polyline, arc, circle and shx text.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.PlotStyleDescriptor
member.summary: Returns PlotStyleDescriptor property value.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.Material

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.Mapper
member.summary: Returns a pointer to the active mapper definition.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.Sectionable
member.summary: Returns true if the graphics primitives drawn with this object will participate in sectioning. Returns false if the graphics primitives will not be affected by sectioning operations.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.VisualStyle
member.summary: Returns the object ID of the visual style in the subentity traits.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.DrawFlags

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.ShadowFlags
member.summary: Returns the current shadow flags value, as specified by the last valid call to SetShadowFlags().The default is ShadowsCastAndReceive.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.SubEntityTraits.SelectionOnlyGeometry
member.summary: Returns if the following geometry is only intended for selection.

member.summary: Sets the hotspot and falloff angles for this light, in radians.
member.param: Input hotspot cone angle, in radians. Defines the brightest part of the spot light beam. Must be smaller than or equal to the falloff angle.
Input falloff angle, in radians. Defines the full cone of light. This is also known as the field angle. Must be larger than or equal to the hotspot.

member.summary: Creates a vector using the first three elements of the array.

member.summary: Returns 2D vector with the coordinates corresponding to the decomposition of this vector in the basis uAxis, vAxis in the planar entity plane, where uAxis and vAxis can be found by function call plane.GetCoordinateSystem(p, uAxis, vAxis).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d.AngleOnPlane(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.PlanarEntity)
member.summary: Returns the angle between the orthogonal projection of this vector into the plane through the origin with the same normal as planar entity plane and the zeroth basis vector v0 of the planar entity plane provided by the function plane.GetCoordinateSystem (p, v0, v1).

member.summary: Returns 3D point which is the result of rotation of this vector around the line with axis passing through the origin. Rotation angle is given by the argument angle, where positive direction of rotation is defined by the right-hand rule.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d.Mirror(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Returns the 3D vector which is the result of mirroring of this vector with respect to the plane with the normal normalToPlane passing through the origin.

member.summary: Multiplies this vector with value.

member.summary: Divides value by this vector.

member.summary: Negates this vector, namely sets it to be equal to the vector (-x, -y).

member.summary: Returns a vector orthogonal to this vector, namely the vector ( -y, x).

member.summary: Returns the unit vector codirectional to this vector. The vector is not normalized if its length is less than tolerance.equalVector(), in which case the returned vector is the same as this vector.

member.summary: This method calls Vector3d.IsUnitLength(Tolerance tolerance) with tolerance set to Global.

member.summary: Returns true if this vector is equal to its normalization. Returns false otherwise.

member.summary: This method calls Vector3d.IsParallelTo(Vector3d vector, Tolerance tolerance) with tolerance set to Global.

member.summary: Checks if this vector is parallel to the vector vector. Namely, it checks if after normalization (and negation in case of negative dot product with the vector vector) this vector is within the distance tolerance.equalVector() from the normalization of the vector vector.

member.summary: This method calls Vector3d.IsPerpendicularTo(Vector3d vector, Tolerance tolerance) with tolerance set to Global.

member.summary: Checks if this vector is perpendicular to the vector vector. Namely, it checks if after normalization the dot product of this vector with the normalization of the vector vector is less than tolerance.equalVector() in absolute value.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ActionsToEvaluateCallback
member.summary: AcDbActionsToEvaluateCallback Wrapper This callback is used by AssocAction::getDependentActionsToEvaluate() method to inform about other actions, dependencies or arbitrary objects that should also be evaluated because they depend on the given action that is to be evaluated.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ActionsToEvaluateCallback.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ActionsToEvaluateCallback.NeedsToEvaluate(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocStatus,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This callback method is called by AssocAction::getDependentActionsToEvaluate(). It is a mechanism by which getDependentActionsToEvaluate() informs that an AssocAction, AssocDependency, or an DBObject needs to be evaluated and suggests new status for them that the callback implementation should set. If the given ObjectId is not of an action or of a dependency, but of an arbitrary DBObject, the callback implementation should simply recursively call needsToEvaluate() for all dependencies on that object..
member.param: ObjectId of an AssocAction, AssocDependency or an arbitrary DBObject that needs to be evaluated.
The new evaluation request status of the action or dependency. If it is not an evaluation request, the needsToEvaluate() implementation should not change the status of the action or dependency.
If the action that needs to evaluate is an AssocNetwork, this argument controls whether all the actions owned by the network also need to be evaluated. The caller usually passes true.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback
member.summary: This wraps the ObjectARX AcDbAssocEvaluationCallback class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.EvaluationMode
member.summary: The action needs to call this method at the beginning of the Evaluate() code to obtain the mode in which it should evaluate itself. The default implementation returns ModifyObjectsAssocEvaluationMode.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.BeginActionEvaluation(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocAction)
member.summary: The action informs that it is starting its evaluation. This callback is issued at the beginning of AssocAction.Evaluate() call and should not be issued from the individual EvaluateOverride() method calls. The action is open for write when this callback is issued.
member.param: The action that is being evaluated.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.EndActionEvaluation(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocAction)
member.summary: The action informs that it has finished its evaluation. This callback is issued at the end of AssocAction.Evaluate() call and should not be issued from the individual Evaluate() method calls. The action is open for write when this callback is issued.
member.param: The action that is being evaluated.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.EndActionEvaluationUsingObject(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocAction,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject)
member.summary: The action informs that it is done with using or modifying a DBObject. The action issues this callback just before it closes the object. If the object is a substitute object provided by the client code, the action does not close it.
member.param: The action that is being evaluated.
The same DBObjectId that has been previously passed to the matching BeginActionEvaluationUsingObject() callback.
The object that has been used or modified by the action. It may be NULL if the original object couldn't be opened or if the substitute object was not of the expected type.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.DraggingState
member.summary: The action may inquire of the client code whether the evaluation is happening from inside of the dragging loop and at which stage the dragging is. The custom evaluation callback code may provide this information by implementing this callback.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.CancelActionEvaluation
member.summary: The custom evaluation callback code can request that the action evaluation should be cancelled by implementing this callback predicate. The AssocAction.Evaluate() method checks this predicate just after issuing the BeginActionEvaluation() callback, i.e. just before the action EvaluateOverride() method is called. If a whole associative network is evaluated, this predicate is also checked after evaluating each action in the network to see if the network evaluation should continue. Custom actions can freely add their own calls to check this predicate, particularly if the action evaluation is time consuming.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AssocEvaluationCallback.GetTransformationType
member.summary: Allows the custom evaluation callback code to pass information about what type of transformation (which AutoCAD command) has been performed with the entities prior to action evaluation. The default implementation returns NotSpecified.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetProjectedClosestPointTo(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: This method calls Curve3d.GetProjectedClosestPointTo(Curve3d curve, Vector3d projectDirection, Tolerance tolerance) with tolerance set to Global.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetProjectedClosestPointTo(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Tolerance)
member.summary: Finds the points on the two curves which when projected onto a plane whose normal is projectDirection are the closest points on the projected curves. The return value of this function is the closest point on this curve. This function is mainly used by graphics where projectDirection is the line of sight. In this case, this function returns the points on the two curves that appear to be the closest points between the two curves (but may not be the actual closest points).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetProjectedClosestPointTo(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d)

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetProjectedClosestPointTo(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Tolerance)
member.summary: Returns the point on the curve which when projected onto a plane whose normal is projectDirection is the closest point on the projected curve to the input point. This function is mainly used by graphics where projectDirection is the line of sight. In this case, this function returns the point on the curve that appears to be closest to the input point (but may not be the actual closest point).

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetNormalPoint(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetNormalPoint(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Tolerance)
member.summary: Finds the point on the input curve whose normal passes through the input point. The returned point lies on a plane that also contains the input point and is perpendicular to the curve tangent at that point. The returned point is therefore at a local minimum or a local maximum from the input point.

member.summary: Returns the entity that is the projection of the curve onto the projection plane in the specified direction. The projectDirection vector must not be parallel to the projection plane. The returned entity may not be of the same type as the original curve and may not even be a curve (for instance, a line projects into a point if it is parallel to projectDirection). The returned entity is created with the new operator and it is the responsibility of the caller to delete it.
member.param: Input plane on which curve is to be projected
Input direction in which curve is to be projected

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetTrimmedOffset(System.Double,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.OffsetCurveExtensionType)
member.summary: This method calls Curve3d.GetTrimmedOffset(Double distance, Vector3d planeNormal, OffsetCurveExtensionType extensionType, Tolerance tolerance) with tolerance set to Global.
member.param: Input normal vector to plane of curve
Input determines how offset curve will be extended at points of C1 discontinuity

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Curve3d.GetTrimmedOffset(System.Double,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.OffsetCurveExtensionType,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Tolerance)
member.summary: Returns one or more offset curves that represent the trimmed offset of the curve. The curve must be planar and planeNormal must be perpendicular to the plane of the curve. The positive direction of offset at a point on the curve is taken to be the cross product of planeNormal with the tangent vector at that point. The curve may be offset in either of two directions by specifying a positive or negative offset distance; planeNormal determines which direction is the positive direction of offset. The returned offset curves are trimmed so that they do not contain any points of self-intersection.
member.param: Input normal vector to plane of curve
Input determines how offset curve will be extended at points of C1 discontinuity

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Context
member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcGiContext ObjectARX class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Context.DisableFastMoveDrag
member.summary: For plane transformations it is possible for a graphics system to maintain a cache of the graphics primitives and apply a transformation to those primitives, instead of requerying the object. This works fine for many objects. However if an object would not perform such a transformation, but performs some other operation, then the drag image would not represent the true state of the object. By calling this method, the object is indicating that it requires to be queried for each transformation.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Context.IsPostScriptOut
member.summary: Returns true if the regen is for the purposes of PostScript out; otherwise, returns false.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Context.IsPlotGeneration
member.summary: Returns true if the regen is for hard copy output; otherwise, returns false.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Context.Database
member.summary: Every regeneration relates to a specific database, and if your object needs to query the database for any purpose, this is the database you should use. This is in contrast to using the database returned by the DBObject.database() method.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Context.IsBoundaryClipping
member.summary: Returns true if boundary clipping is currently active. This indicates that any primitive drawn will be clipped to a boundary. For clarification, if this version of supports clipping but there is currently no active clip boundary, the return value would be false.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.ConvertToRedirectedId
member.summary: This function will take the object ID for this object if it has been redirected from another database, and convert it to the actual object ID for the other database (for example: the object ID from an xref database). If this object ID is not redirected or if it has a value of Null, the function will do nothing.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.ObjectClass
member.summary: Accesses the RXClass of the object that is associated with the object id, thus guaranteeing that the result can be safely de-referenced and correctly compared against any class derived from DBObject. This is done because the entire purpose of this property is to streamline code being written; having to always compare the result against NULL would partially defeat the purpose of the function.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.OldIdPtr
member.summary: Accesses the objectId value as a long, which is the old format (an is an array of two longs, the first element of which contains the same value as that in an objectId).

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.Database
member.summary: Accesses the database in which the object ID is resident. If the object ID is NULL, then NULL is returned.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.IsNull
member.summary: Assesses if the object ID has a null value.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.IsValid
member.summary: Assesses if the object ID is associated with a database that is currently in memory. If the object ID is associated with a database that is no longer available (in other words, has been deleted), then the value is false.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.IsErased
member.summary: Assesses if the object associated with this object ID is erased.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.IsEffectivelyErased
member.summary: Assesses true if the object associated with this object ID is erased or if any of the owners in the ownership hierarchy for the object (in other words, the object's owner, the object's owner's owner, etc.) are erased.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.OriginalDatabase
member.summary: If this object ID is in an xref database and the object associated with this object ID has been redirected to the host database, then this property will return a pointer to the xref database. If the object associated with this object ID is not from an xref database or is not redirected, then this property's value is the same as ObjectId.Database.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.Handle
member.summary: Accesses the handle of the object associated with the object ID.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.NonForwardedHandle
member.summary: If this object ID is in an xref database and the object associated with this object ID has been redirected to the host database, then the value of this property is the handle in the xref database. If the object associated with this objectId is not from an xref database or is not redirected, then this method is the same as ObjectId.Handle.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.Null
member.summary: Accesses a null object ID. This property allows more compact expressions to be used and helps the compiler generate better code (it knows the ObjectId is zero instead of having to lookup the Null object).

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId.IsResident
member.summary: Assesses if the object associated with this objectId is resident in memory.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData
member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcGiEdgeData ObjectARX class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.SetTrueColors(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Colors.EntityColor[])
member.summary: Sets the true colors for this entity to colors.The colors array must have the same number of elements as there are edges in the mesh or shell with which it is used. The array elements control individual edge colors. The order of the array elements corresponds to the order of the edges in the mesh or shell. The first array element is used as the color for the first mesh or shell edge, the second element for the second edge, and so on.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.SetLayers(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId[])
member.summary: Sets layers to be the array of LayerTableRecord object IDs used by this object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are edges in the mesh or shell it is used with.
member.param: Input array of LayerTableRecord object IDs.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.SetLineTypes(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId[])
member.summary: Sets lineTypes to be the array of LinetypeTableRecord object IDs used by this object.The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are edges in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements control the linetypes used for the mesh or shell edges--the first array element specifies the linetype used for the first edge, the second element for the second edge, etc.
member.param: Input array of LinetypeTableRecord object IDs

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.GetTrueColors
member.summary: Returns the true colors defined for this entity.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.GetLayers
member.summary: Returns the array of LayerTableRecord object IDs, one for each edge in the mesh or shell with which this object is used. If the layer ID array has not been set, an empty array is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.GetLineTypes
member.summary: Returns the array of LinetypeTableRecord object IDs, one for each edge in the mesh or shell with which this object is used. If the linetype ID array has not been set, an empty array is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.GetSelectionMarkers
member.summary: Returns a pointer to an array of graphic system selection markers (gsmarkers), one for each edge in the mesh or shell the EdgeData object is used with. If the selectionMarker's data array has not been set, then NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.GetVisibility
member.summary: Returns a pointer to an array of visibility flags (that is, 0 == invisible, 1 == visible), one for each edge in the mesh or shell the EdgeData object is used with. If the visibility flags data array has not been set, then NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.SetSelectionMarkers(System.IntPtr[])
member.summary: Sets selectionMarkers to be the array of graphics system selection markers (gsmarkers) used by the EdgeData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are edges in the mesh or shell it is used with.
member.param: Input array of non-zero graphic system selection markers.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.SetVisibility(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets visibility to be the array of edge visibility flags used by this object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are edges in the mesh or shell it is used with.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.SetColors(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Sets colors to be the array of edge color indices used by this object.The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are edges in the mesh or shell it is used with.
member.param: Input array of AutoCAD color indices.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.EdgeData.GetColors
member.summary: Returns an array of AutoCAD color indices, one for each edge in the mesh or shell with which this object is used. If the colors array has not been set, an empty array is returned.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData
member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcGiFaceData ObjectARX class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetColors(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Sets colors to be the array of face color indices used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements control the individual face colors. The order of the array elements corresponds with the order of the faces in the mesh or shell--the first array element is used as the color index for the first mesh or shell face, the second element for the second face, etc.
member.param: Input array of AutoCAD color indices

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetTrueColors(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Colors.EntityColor[])
member.summary: This function sets the array of face color used by the FaceData object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetLayers(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId[])
member.summary: Sets layers to be the array of LayerTableRecord object IDs used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements control the layers the mesh or shell faces reside on--the first array element specifies the layer used for the first face, the second element for the second face, etc.
member.param: Input array of LayerTableRecord object IDs

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetNormalVectors(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d[])
member.summary: Sets normal to be the array of face normal vectors used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements specify the normal vectors of the mesh or shell faces--the first array element specifies the normal vector for the first face, the second element for the second face, etc.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetVisibility(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets visibility to be the array of face visibility flags used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetColors
member.summary: Returns an array of AutoCAD color indices, one for each face in the mesh or shell with which this object is used. If the colors array has not been set, an empty array is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetLayers
member.summary: Returns an array of LayerTableRecord object IDs, one for each face in the mesh or shell the FaceData object is used with. If the layerId's data array has not been set, then NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetSelectionMarkers
member.summary: Returns an array of graphic system selection markers (gsmarkers), one for each face in the mesh or shell the FaceData object is used with. If the selectionMarker's data array has not been set, then NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetSelectionMarkers(System.IntPtr[])
member.summary: Sets selectionMarker to be the array of graphics system selection markers (gsmarkers) used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements control the graphic system selection markers (gsmarkers) used for the mesh or shell faces--the first array element specifies the gsmarker used for the first face, the second element for the second face, etc.
member.param: Input array of non-zero graphic system selection markers.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetNormalVectors
member.summary: Returns the array of normal vectors, one for each face in the mesh or shell with which this object is used. If the normal vector array has not been set, an empty array is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetTrueColors
member.summary: Returns the array of EntityColor objects, one for each face in the mesh or shell with which this object is used. If the true color array has not been set, an empty array is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetVisibility
member.summary: Returns an array of visibility flags (that is, 0 == invisible, 1 == visible), one for each face in the mesh or shell the FaceData object is used with. If the visibility flag's data array has not been set, then NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetMaterials(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.ObjectId[])
member.summary: Sets materials to the array of face materials used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements control the individual face material. The order of the array elements corresponds with the order of the faces in the mesh or shell--the first array element is used as the material for the first mesh or shell face, the second element for the second face, etc. For faces that do not have a per-face material override, the corresponding entries should be occupied by ObjectId.Null.
member.param: Input array of materials to be set on the this object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetMaterials
member.summary: Returns the array of materials assigned to the FaceData object. Please refer to FaceData.SetMaterials for how materials are mapped to individual faces.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetMappers(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Mapper[])
member.summary: Sets mappers to be the array of face mappers used by the FaceData object. The array must have exactly the same number of elements as there are faces in the mesh or shell it is used with. The array elements control the individual face mapper. The order of the array elements corresponds with the order of the faces in the mesh or shell--the first array element is used as the mapper for the first mesh or shell face, the second element for the second face, etc. For faces that do not have a per-face mapper override, the corresponding entries should be occupied by Mapper.Identity.
member.param: Input face mappers to be set on the this object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetMappers
member.summary: Returns the array of mappers assigned to the FaceData object. Refer to FaceData.SetMappers for how mappers are mapped to individual faces.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.SetTransparency(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Colors.Transparency[])
member.summary: This .NET method wraps the ObjectARX method AcGiFaceData::setTransparency.
member.param: Input Autodesk.AutoCAD.Colors.Transparency to set into the FaceData.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.FaceData.GetTransparency
member.summary: This .NET method wraps the ObjectARX method AcGiFaceData::transparency.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.VertexData
member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcGiVertexData ObjectARX class. This class is a container for the optional data that can be specified for a set of vertices for meshes and shells. An object of this class is meant to be passed in as an argument to Geometry.mesh() and AcGiGeometry.shell().

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.VertexData.SetNormalVectors(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d[])
member.summary: Sets normal to be the array of face normal vectors used by this object. Input one array for each vertex in the mesh or shell, or NULL if specification of normal is not desired at the vertices.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.VertexData.SetTrueColors(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Colors.EntityColor[])
member.summary: Read-only.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.VertexData.GetTrueColors
member.summary: Returns the true colors defined for this entity.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.VertexData.GetNormalVectors
member.summary: Returns the vertex normal currently in use by the VertexData object. The object returned is either NULL or points to an array which has exactly the same number of elements as there are vertices in the mesh or shell. If the pointer is not NULL, then each of the elements in the array pointed to is a valid Model Coordinate System vector, which is used as the normal for the corresponding vertex in the mesh or shell's vertex array.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.VertexData.OrientationFlag
member.summary: Returns the current orientation type for vertices. The orientation type indicates the direction the vertices in a mesh or shell appear to follow when viewed in order while looking down the normal axis towards any given vertex. Essentially the orientation type defines the normal's positive or negative direction at the vertices.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LayerStateManager.ImportLayerState(System.String)
member.summary: ImportLayerState() reads the passed-in filename (saved by a previous export) and extracts layer states to import. If an import file layer state has the same name as a layer state already existing in the drawing, the imported layer state is ignored. If an import file layer state name is not found in the drawing, it is created in the drawing. If any newly-created layer states refer to layers which are nonexistent in the drawing, the layers are created using default settings.
member.param: Input file to extract layer states from

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LayerStateManager.ExportLayerState(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: ExportLayerState() reads the passed-in layer state name and exports the corresponding layer state to the export file. The layer state name must be passed with a single 0 after the name.
member.param: Input layer state name to export
Input filename to export layer state to

member.summary: Imports the layer state name passed in name from the open drawing file pointer passed in database. This method will also import linetypes, materials and plot styles that are saved in the imported layer state but are missing in the current drawing. This method allows importing of layer states directly from drawing files rather than having to export to an .LAS file format in order to import a layer state.

Input a pointer to a valid, readable database from which the layer state is to be imported.

member.summary: Adds the class protocol extension object protocolObject into the protocol extension object dictionary of Class object. The search key is protocolClass, which is the Class object for the class of protocolObject. The value is the protocol object protocolObject.
member.param: Input object for the protocol extension class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.GetX(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass)
member.summary: Returns the protocol extension object stored with the key protocolClass. If there is no such object specific to the class represented by this Class object, then the protocol extension object for the parent class is used, or its parent class, or on up the hierarchy as far as needed to obtain the protocol extension object sought.
member.param: Input object for the protocol extension class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.DelX(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass)
member.summary: Searches the Class object's protocol extension dictionary for an entry with the key protocolClass, and if found, removes the entry. If an entry is found and removed, the protocol extension object removed is returned; otherwise NULL is returned.
member.param: Input object for the protocol extension class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.QueryX(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass)
member.summary: Returns the protocol extension object stored with the key protocolClass. If there is no such object specific to the class represented by this Class object, then the protocol extension object for the parent class is used, or its parent class, or on up the hierarchy as far as needed to obtain the protocol extension object sought.
member.param: Input Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass object for the protocol extension class.

This string is used as the application identifier in the error dialog that is displayed whenever an object of the class is loaded and the application is not present.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.DxfName
member.summary: Returns the DXF name for the class. This string is only required to be non-NULL for classes derived from DBObject. member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.Name
member.summary: Returns a string that is the name of the C++ class represented by this Class object.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.ClassVersion
member.summary: Returns DWG_VERSION and MAINTENANCE_VERSION, which must be specified when the class is registered. These are mandatory, and there is no default. The data members are not persistent; in other words, they are not written to the DWG/DXF files.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.ProxyFlags
member.summary: Returns the value which was set as the third parameter to either the global newClass() pseudo-constructor or the ACRX_DXF_DEFINE_MEMBERS macro.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass.MyParent
member.summary: Returns the Class object associated with the base class of the class that is represented by the Class object on which this method is called.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.DynamicLinker

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.DynamicLinker.LoadModule(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads the fileName ObjectARX program. fileName is the application name as set in the operating system registry. If the ObjectARX application does not have an entry in the registry, or if the registry entry has the AcadApp.LoadDisabled load reason set, or if any of the the LoadReasons in reasons do not match the LoadReasons in the application's registry entry, then this function will be unable to load the application..
member.param: Input name of the file to load.
Input indicating whether or not to print load status message.
Input indicating whether to load the application as if by user command.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.DynamicLinker.UnloadModule(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Unloads the fileName ObjectARX program. fileName is the application name as set in the operating system registry. If the ObjectARX application was not loaded via the DynamicLinker.loadApp() method or through the demand loading mechanism (all of which use the system registry entry for the application), then this function will be unable to unload the application..
member.param: Input null-terminated string which is the file name of the program to unload.
Input indicating whether to unload the application as if by user command.

If the ObjectARX application does not have an entry in the registry, or if the registry entry has the AcadApp.LoadDisabled load reason set, or if any of the the LoadReasons in reasons do not match the LoadReasons in the application's registry entry, then this function will be unable to load the application..
member.param: Input null-terminated string which is the application name (as set in the system registry) of the ObjectARX module to load

member.summary: This method is used to convert a string to a LineWeight value. It attempts to interpret value as a System.String object. If successful, it attempts to find a matching string in the LineWeight enum. If a match is found, this method returns the matching LineWeight value. If no match is found, this method throws a FormatException exception. If value cannot be cast to a System.String object, this method calls the superclass version of this method.

Input culture within which to handle value

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.ExtensionApplicationAttribute
member.summary: This class defines a custom attribute that marks an assembly as an ObjectDBX/AutoCAD extension. The type that this attribute represents must implement the IExtensionApplication interface. member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXObject.X(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass)
member.summary: Searches for a protocol extension object associated with this class. The method begins the search by examining the Class object associated with this class, and if no protocol extension object is found, the search continues in this class's base class and so on up the inheritance tree for this class. This procedure provides a form of protocol extension inheritance. This class's Class member may be found by using this class's isA() method.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXObject.QueryX(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass)
member.summary: Searches for a protocol extension object associated with this object. The method begins the search by examining the Class object associated with this object, and if no protocol extension object is found, the search continues in the base class of the object's class and so on up the inheritance tree for the class. This procedure provides a form of protocol extension inheritance. An object's Class member may be found by using the class's isA() method.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject
member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcDbObject ObjectARX class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DeepClone(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.IdMapping,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function gives control of deep clone operations to the object. In the default implementation, the object is cloned and appended to the owner object (ownerPointer). The cloning is performed by an DeepCloneFiler. A record is also added to the idMap. Then, using the filer, any owned objects are deep cloned, with isPrimary set to false.
member.param: Object to which the clones should be appended
Boolean indicating whether this object is primary or owned

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.WblockClone(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXObject,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.IdMapping,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function is almost identical to DBObject.DeepClone, except that a WblockCloneFiler is used and ownership is not carried across database boundaries. Subcloning is based on hard owner and hard pointer connections.
member.param: Input object to which the clones should be appended. If the owner has not been cloned, then the Database must be passed in.
Input Boolean indicating whether this object is primary or owned

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DecomposeForSave(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DwgVersion)
member.summary: This member function is used to control behavior for custom objects and entities when saving to previous formats. Custom objects can decompose themselves into other objects and can add additional xdata to the objects created.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.CreateExtensionDictionary
member.summary: Creates a DBDictionary object and sets it up as the extension dictionary for the DBObject.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.ReleaseExtensionDictionary
member.summary: Removes the object's extension dictionary (that is, removes the object as the owner of the dictionary object) if it exists and is empty. Once removed, this function calls the dictionary's erase() method. Any reactors attached to the extension dictionary receive normal notification appropriate to an open for write, erase, close sequence.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.UpgradeOpen
member.summary: If the object is currently open OpenMode.ForRead with only one reader, then this function upgrades the object to open OpenMode.ForWrite. In the process of changing to open for write, the object is closed, thus triggering any pertinent notification.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.UpgradeFromNotify
member.summary: Upgrades the object from being at least open OpenMode.ForNotify to being open both OpenMode.ForNotify and OpenMode.ForWrite.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DowngradeOpen
member.summary: Downgrades the object from being open OpenMode.ForWrite, to being OpenMode.ForRead. In the process, all changes made to the object while it was open for write are committed to the database and appropriate notification is sent.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DowngradeToNotify(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Restores an object from being open both OpenMode.ForNotify and OpenMode.ForWrite, to being open just OpenMode.ForNotify. The wasWritable value that was returned from the matching DBObject.upgradeFromNotify() call should be passed into this function to restore the proper open status..
member.param: Input indicating if object was open for write when upgradeFromNotify was called

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.Cancel
member.summary: Terminates the current open operation. All changes made to.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.Close
member.summary: Closes the object. All changes made to the object since it was opened are committed to the database, the object is marked as pageable, and a "closed" notification (as well as any other appropriate notification such as "modified", "erased", and so on) is sent.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.CloseAndPage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the object and pages it if the object pager is turned on. All changes made to the object since it was opened are committed to the database, and a "closed" notification (as well as any other appropriate notification such as "modified", "erased", and so on) is sent.
member.param: Boolean indicating to turn off or on undo recording

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.Erase
member.summary: Sets the erase bit of the object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.Erase(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the erase bit of the object.
member.param: Boolean indicating if object is to be erased or unerased

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.SwapReferences(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.IdMapping)
member.summary: The purpose of this method is similar to the object ID reference translations done at the end of deep cloning. References between objects in the workset have their object IDs translated to the swapped object IDs of the referenced objects. Unlike cloning, this translation must happen in both directions. Thus, it is possible to see two different ID maps passed in on different calls to this method.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.Audit(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.AuditInfo)
member.summary: This function is called by AutoCAD when the AUDIT command is executed. The AuditInfo object pointed to by auditInfo contains member functions that are used to determine what to do and also to report the results of the audit operation on the object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DwgIn(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DwgFiler)
member.summary: This function does some internal bookkeeping, calls the object's DBObject.dwgInFields() function, and then reads in any xdata attached to the object. If the object's dwgInFields() function does not supermessage its parent class, then an assert is triggered.
member.param: DWG filer to be used for this filing operation

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DwgOut(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DwgFiler)
member.summary: This function does some internal bookkeeping, calls the object's DBObject.dwgOutFields() function, and then writes out any xdata attached to the object. If the object's dwgOutFields() function does not supermessage its parent class, then an assert is triggered.
member.param: DWG filer to be used for this filing operation

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DxfIn(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DxfFiler)
member.summary: This function does some internal book keeping by reading in any xdata that comes before the main entity data. The dxfIn function then calls the object's DBObject.dxfInFields() function, and then reads in any xdata that comes after the entity data.
member.param: DXF filer to be used for this filing operation

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.DxfOut(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DxfFiler)
member.summary: This function does some internal bookkeeping, calls the object's DBObject.dxfOutFields() function, and then writes out any xdata attached to the object.
member.param: Filer to be used for this filing operation

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.XDataTransformBy(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Matrix3d)
member.summary: This method applies the xform transformation matrix to any XData data types 1011, 1021, 1031, 1012, 1022, 1032, 1013, 1023, 1033, 1041, and 1042 in the object's XData. See the documentation on XData for more information on the way the transformation matrix is applied to the different data types.
member.param: Transformation matrix to be applied to the XData

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DBObject.ApplyPartialUndo(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.DwgFiler,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Runtime.RXClass)
