member.summary: Returns a DatabaseServices.LoftOptions object.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.DraftStart
member.summary: Accesses the start draft angle in radians. This is the surface take-off direction at the first cross section. The default value of this option is 0, which indicates that no draft angle is defined and the system will compute the optimum angle at the first cross section.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.DraftEnd
member.summary: Accesses the end draft angle in radians. This is the surface take-off direction at the last cross section. The default value of this option is 0, which indicates that no draft angle is defined and the system will compute the optimum angle at the last cross section.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.DraftStartMag
member.summary: Accesses the start draft magnitude. Controls the magnitude of the surface tangent vector at the first cross-section. The default value of this option is 0, which means that the system will compute the optimum magnitude.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.DraftEndMag
member.summary: Accesses the end draft magnitude. Controls the magnitude of the surface tangent vector at the last cross-section. The default value of this option is 0, which means that the system will compute the optimum magnitude.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.ArcLengthParam
member.summary: Accesses the arc length parametrization.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.NoTwist
member.summary: Accesses the value of the noTwist option. This option can be used to minimize the amount of twist in the resulting surface or solid when the cross-sections are all closed. The default value of this option is true. If this option is set then the start point of each closed cross-section is aligned with the other cross-sections to minimize twist.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.AlignDirection
member.summary: Accesses the value of the AlignDirection option. This option can be used to orient each of the cross sections so that the normal vector of each cross section points towards the next cross section. The default value of this option is true. If the cross sections are not all oriented in the same direction, then this option should be used to avoid creating a twisted or self-intersecting surface or solid.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.Simplify
member.summary: Accesses the value of the simplify option. If this option is set, then simple surface types (plane, cylinder, cone, sphere, or torus) will be created whenever all of the cross sections lie on such a surface. Otherwise a general surface type will be created. The default value of this option is true.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.Closed
member.summary: Accesses the value of the closed option. If this option is set, then the resulting surface/solid will start and end at the first cross section. If all of the cross sections are closed, then this will result in a torus-like shape. If this option is not set, then the surface or solid will be open or capped with a planar surface at the first and last cross sections. The default value of this option is false. If this option is set, then there must be at least three cross sections.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.Ruled
member.summary: Accesses the value of the ruled option. If this option is set then a ruled surface will be created between each pair of cross sections rather than a single smooth surface. This will result in a much coarser object. The default value of this option is false.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.VirtualGuide
member.summary: Accesses the state of the virtual guide option.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.LoftOptionsBuilder.NormalOption
member.summary: Accesses the plane normal option. See LoftOptionsNormalOption for a description of possible values. The default value of this option is NoNormal.

member.summary: Adds a new node to the graph. The node must be created on the heap and should not be deleted once it has been added to the graph. The graph will take care of deleting it when necessary. You cannot add a node to more than one graph.

member.summary: Adds an edge between two nodes to the graph. Neither node can be NULL, and must have already been added to this same graph. from->out() will now have an entry pointing to toPointer, as will toPointer->in() have an entry pointing to from.
member.param: Input the node to begin the edge at
Input the node to end the edge at

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.DelNode(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GraphNode)
member.summary: Completely removes a node from the graph. It also disconnects the references from other nodes to this node, if present.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.Reset
member.summary: Deletes all of the nodes and cycle nodes, and resets the graph to being empty. This is also called by Graph's destructor.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.ClearAll(System.Byte)
member.summary: Used to clear the flag bit(s) in all the nodes in the graph.
member.param: Input flag values to clear for all nodes in the graph

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.GetOutgoing
member.summary: Takes the nodes and returns all of the outgoing nested nodes as a collection. It sets the Selected bit on the original nodes in the array, and sets the InList bit on all the nodes in the resulting collection. Each node in the list will appear in the collection only once.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.FindCycles(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GraphNode)
member.summary: Sets up the internal cycle graph in order to find and label all nodes which cause circular references. The cycle information is kept within the graph, like a cache. An internal dirty bit indicates when the graph has changed, so that the cycle information needs to be updated. So, it is important to call FindCycles() whenever changes might have occured in the graph, before accessing any of the cycle information functions, such as GraphNode.IsCycleNode(). Calling FindCycles() when the graph has not changed simply checks the existing information, and is efficient.
member.param: Input node to begin the search for cycles at. Usually defaulted to NULL.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.BreakCycleEdge(Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GraphNode,Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GraphNode)
member.summary: This method is used to break a cycle at a particular point. It removes both the cycle reference and the real reference between from and toPointer. It then calls FindCycles() to update the cycle information changes which result from the break.
member.param: Input node that the edge begins at
Input node that the edge ends at

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.Graph.SetNodeGrowthRate(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method sets the number of nodes that are allocated to the graph at a time. If the graph consists of many nodes, this method should be called to increase the rate from the default of 8 nodes at a time. Setting a rate to a higher value increases performance but may cause increased memory usage due to unused but allocated node space.
member.param: Number of nodes to allocate at once

member.summary: Accesses the root, or first, node in the graph. Returns NULL if the first node is NULL; that is, the graph is empty.

member.summary: Accesses the number of nodes in the graph.

member.summary: Assesses if the graph is empty.

member.summary: Removes all of the references between this node and any In() or Out() nodes, or CycleIn() and CycleOut() nodes. It is always called in the destructor. It has the effect of cleaning up any node pointers to this node.

member.summary: Marks this node and all nested out() nodes with the flags value supplied. If an collection is passed in, it also appends this node, and the nested Out() nodes, to the collection. If it finds that this node or any nested nodes already have the flag bit(s) set, it does not follow that branch any further.

Input collection that this node and all nested out nodes should optionally be appended to

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.GraphNode.SetEdgeGrowthRate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method sets the number of outgoing and incoming edges that are allocated at a time on a graph node. If the node-to-node relationship contains many edges, this method should be called to increase the rate of the outgoing and incoming edges from the defaults of 4 and 2 respectively. Setting the rates to higher values increases performance but may increase memory usage.

Number of incoming edges allocated at one time

member.summary: This method sets a flag on an Layout object to indicate that a zoom to the associated paper image represented by the underlying Layout be performed if the paper receives update notification. An update notification can occur in a number of ways, but the most explicit is to call the UpdateCurrentPaper() method on the Layout Manager. It doesn't get notification, however, merely by setting attributes on the Layout object.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.MakeDependentName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Performs the necessary concatenation of the specified drawing name and symbol name to create a dependent symbol name. No validation of the drawing name, symbol name, or the resulting symbol name is done.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.RepairPreExtendedSymbolName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method returns a "repaired" copy of the specified string. The method uses the same symbol name validation rules as the validation functions (such as validatePreExtendedSymbolname() and validateSymbolName()) except that the returned copy of the string does not contain any illegal characters. Those are replaced with valid replacement characters.
member.param: Input Boolean to indicate is vertical bars are allowed in the symbol name

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.RepairSymbolName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method returns a "repaired" copy of the specified string. The method uses the same symbol name validation rules as the validation functions (such as validatePreExtendedSymbolname() and validateSymbolName()) except that the returned copy of the string does not contain any illegal characters. Those are replaced with valid replacement characters.
member.param: Input Boolean to indicate if vertical bars are allowed in the symbol name

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.ValidatePreExtendedSymbolName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method validates name according to the rules for legacy (AutoCAD Release 14 and earlier) symbol names. name should be a non-NULL pointer. allowVerticalBar should be true to indicate that vertical bars should be considered valid characters in the symbol name, or false if not. name is normalized before validating.
member.param: Input Boolean to indicate if vertical bars are valid in the symbol name

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.ValidateSymbolName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method validates name according to the rules for extended (AutoCAD 2000 and later) symbol names. name should be a non-NULL pointer. allowVerticalBar should be true to indicate that vertical bars should be considered valid characters in the symbol name, or false if not. name is normalized before validating.
member.param: Input Boolean to indicate if vertical bars are valid in the symbol name

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.GetBlockNameFromInsertPathName(System.String)
member.summary: Extract a suitable block name from a pathname. This method calls the GetSymbolNameFromPathName() method with "DXF;DWG" as the list of extensions to check.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.GetInsertPathNameFromBlockName(System.String)
member.summary: This function copies the string pointed to by blockName (or an empty string if blockName is null) into the path name string. It then checks to see if the string ends with a .dwg or .dxf extension. This check is not case-sensitive. If the string does not have either extension, then .dwg is appended to the end of the path name string.
member.param: Input name of block from which to get the path

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.GetMaxSymbolNameLength(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the maximum allowed length for symbol names, if applicable..
member.param: Input Boolean to indicate whether we want to the length for extended or legacy symbol names
Input Boolean to indicate extended or legacy symbol names

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.GetPathNameFromSymbolName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This function copies the string pointed to by symbolName (or an empty string if symbolName is null) into path name. It then checks to see if the string ends with one of the extensions specified in extensions. This check is not case-sensitive. If the string does not end in one of the extensions specified in extensions, then a period ('.') followed by the first extension specified in extensions is appended to the end of the path name string.
member.param: Input name of block from which to get the path
Input list of extensions for which to search

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.GetSymbolNameFromPathName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts a suitable symbol name from a path name. The symbol name is the filename component of the path. Any of the specified filename extensions are removed. Lexical analysis of only the specified path is performed, and no attempt is made at any type of pathname validation or symbol name validation. Thus, the input pathname may be an invalid pathname and the resulting block name may be an invalid block name. If the pathname pointer is null, it is treated as an empty string. The solidus (/) and backslash (\) are treated as delimiters for directory names. Note that this function is meant to encapsulate a convention for extracting a block name from a pathname. It is not intended for use as a general purpose filename parsing utility.
member.param: Input list of extensions to consider

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.DatabaseServices.SymbolUtilityServices.PreValidateSymbolName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform any "pre-validation" steps on a string that will be validated as a symbol name:.
member.param: Input Boolean to indicate whether to preserve the case of alphabetic letters

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.SetViewportClipRegion(System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: This method is used to specify a clip region distinct from the rectangular region supplied via SetViewport(). The region consists of the union of a set of polygons (each may be self-intersecting) determined by the application of the even-odd winding rule to the specified contour; this region is open (it does not include the contour itself).
member.param: Input number of polygonal contours and the size of the counts array.

Input array where each entry corresponds to the number of device coordinate points used to specify that contour in the points array. For example, counts[i] contains the number of points that represent the (ith + 1) polygonal contour.
Input array of points that specify polygonal contours.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.RemoveViewportClipRegion
member.summary: Removes the effect of any previous SetViewportClipRegion() call, restoring the viewport to a rectangular clip region specified in SetViewport().

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.SetView(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the camera parameters needed to define the transformation from world space to normalized device coordinates. All values are specified in the world space coordinate system. Ensure that the camera position and target are distinct. As well, the specified upVector cannot be parallel to the eye vector (computed as the vector from the target to the position). fieldWidth and fieldHeight help define the transformation from view space to normalized device coordinates.
member.param: Input width of the projection plane.
Input height of the projection plane.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Add(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable,Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model)
member.summary: Specifies which portions of which models are viewed by this view. The proper way to employ this function is to construct a directed acyclic graph (the scene graph) of Drawable objects, each of which tells the Graphic System to draw its children by using Geometry.Draw(). Add the root of this graph (a Drawable) and the Model that handles its notifications with this method. This method always returns true.
member.param: Input object to which all notifications for the above scene graph are directed.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Erase(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable)
member.summary: Removes the specified drawable from the list of viewed drawables.
member.param: Input object to be removed from the view.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.EraseAll
member.summary: Removes all drawables from a view.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Invalidate
member.summary: Use this method to indicate that the view needs to be redrawn.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Update
member.summary: When called non-interactively, this method flushes any queued graphics to the device. This may involve a full transformation and rasterization pass (which can be quite expensive).When called interactively, this method requests an update (but one is not guaranteed); the call returns immediately, and any transformation and rasterization occur asynchronously.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.BeginInteractivity(System.Double)
member.summary: Puts the view into the interactive state.
member.param: Input desired frame rate per second.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.EndInteractivity
member.summary: Terminates the interactive state.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Flush
member.summary: Use this method to stimulate an interactive View to flush its message queue, upgrade (if degradation has occurred), and attempt to render the frame. During this rendering pass, tessellated objects will employ the appropriate level of detail (which may trigger a regeneration of those objects). Only use this method during interactivity.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Hide
member.summary: Makes the view invisible. Nothing from this view should appear on the device while it is hidden.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Show
member.summary: Restores a hidden view to a visible state.

member.summary: Informs the view that the specified layer should be thawed in this view. ThawLayer() only needs to be called if the layer was previously frozen in the view.
member.param: Input Layer to be treated as thawed.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ClearFrozenLayers
member.summary: Clears all previously frozen layers in the view.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.InvalidateCachedViewportGeometry
member.summary: Informs the Graphic System that all view-independent viewportDraw geometry is invalid and needs to be regenerated in this view.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Dolly(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Translates the camera target and position by the specified camera space dolly amounts. All other camera parameters are left unaffected. The basis of camera space is as follows: positive Y is along the up vector, positive Z is along the eye vector from the camera position to the camera target, and X is the cross product of those two vectors.
member.param: Input Camera space y dolly amount.
Input Camera space z dolly amount.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Dolly(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Translates the camera target and position by the specified camera space dolly vector. All other camera parameters are left unaffected. The basis of camera space is as follows: positive Y is along the up vector, positive Z is along the eye vector from the camera position to the camera target, and X is the cross product of those two vectors.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Roll(System.Double)
member.summary: Rotates the cameras up vector about the eye vector by the specified amount in radians. Positive angles correspond to a clockwise rotation when viewed from the camera position to the camera target.
member.param: Input angular rotation about the eye vector in radians.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Orbit(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Orbits the camera. During orbit, the camera target and distance from position to target remain fixed; the camera position moves along the surface of a sphere described by these constraints. The X and Y parameters are in radians and correspond to angles traversed on this sphere along the cross product of the up vector and the eye vector (X) and along the up vector (Y). The X component of the orbit is performed before the Y component.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Zoom(System.Double)
member.summary: Changes the viewing field (the focal length) of the camera to give the effect of dynamically moving in or out of a scene. The camera position and target are not changed. The specified factor must be positive.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ZoomExtents(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Modifies the current view such that the input bounding box defined by the two extents points is completely within the view.
member.param: Input WCS point representing the corner of the bounding box extents.
Input WCS point representing the corner of the bounding box extents.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ZoomWindow(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point2d,Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point2d)
member.summary: Modifies the current view such that the new window displays the region defined by the input screen coordinates. The aspect ratio is automatically maintained.
member.param: Input screen coordinate of the lower-left point of the new zoom window.
Input screen coordinate of the upper-right point of the new zoom window.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.Pan(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Pans the camera. During pan, the camera position and distance from position to target remain fixed; the camera target moves along the surface of a sphere described by these constraints. The X and Y parameters are in radians and correspond to angles traversed on this sphere along the cross product of the up vector and the eye vector (X) and along the up vector (Y). The X component of the pan is performed before the Y component.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.PointInView(Autodesk.AutoCAD.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Returns true if point is visible in the view frustum of this object.

member.summary: Returns true if the bounding box defined by minPoint and maxPoint is at least partially visible in the view frustum of the current View object.
member.param: Input WCS point of the corner of the bounding box extents.
Input WCS point of the corner of the bounding box extents.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ViewportId
member.summary: The viewport ID as a System.IntPtr. This is the same value as is available through the Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.ViewportId property. This is an ID that has no relation to the AutoCAD CVPORT system variable. The ID returned by this function is unique for every viewport in AutoCAD (including Paper Space AcDbViewports and tiled view viewports, AcDbViewportTableRecords), much the way a handle is for an entity.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.AcadWindowId
member.summary: The viewport ID as a System.IntPtr. This is the same value as is available through the Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Viewport.ViewportId property. This is an ID that has no relation to the AutoCAD CVPORT system variable. The ID returned by this function is unique for every viewport in AutoCAD (including Paper Space AcDbViewports and tiled view viewports, AcDbViewportTableRecords), much the way a handle is for an entity.

member.summary: Enables front clipping plane.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.FrontClip
member.summary: Returns the location of the front clipping plane as a world space distance from the camera target along the eye vector towards the camera position.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.EnableBackClip
member.summary: Enables back clipping plane.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.BackClip
member.summary: Returns the location of the back clipping plane as a world space distance from the camera target along the eye vector away from the camera position.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ViewingMatrix
member.summary: Returns the viewing matrix used to transform from world space to view space. Make sure not to use ViewingMatrix when the view is in the interactive state.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ProjectionMatrix
member.summary: Returns the projection matrix used to transform from view space to normalized device space. Make sure not to use ProjectionMatrix when the view is in the interactive state.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ScreenMatrix
member.summary: Returns the screen matrix used to transform from normalized device space to screen space. Make sure not to use ScreenMatrix when the view is in the interactive state.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.WorldToDeviceMatrix
member.summary: Returns the transformation from world space to screen space. This will be the same as the result of the concatenation of the ViewingMatrix, ProjectionMatrix, and ScreenMatrix. Make sure not to use WorldToDeviceMatrix when the view is in the interactive state.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.View.ObjectToDeviceMatrix
member.summary: Returns the transformation from model space to screen space. Make sure not to use ObjectToDeviceMatrix when the view is in the interactive state.

member.summary: Indicates whether any viewing parameters (camera position, camera target, camera field, front/back clip plane distance, and viewing distance) have exceeded their boundaries during execution of any of the following view manipulation calls: setView(), setFrontClip(), setBackClip(), dolly(), roll(), orbit(), zoom(), and pan(), since the previous call to exceededBounds().

member.summary: This .NET class wraps the AcGsModel ObjectARX class.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.#ctor(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.RenderType)
member.summary: Constructs a new model with a render type.
member.param: Input render type to associate with this model

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.AddSceneGraphRoot(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable)
member.summary: Informs this Model that pRoot is a scene graph root. pRoot will remain cached until either eraseSceneGraphRoot() is called to remove it or the Model is destroyed. AutoCAD uses this method to ensure that the Modelspace Block remains cached even if it there are no viewports (this occurs during the VPORTS command and switches from tilemode to or from layout mode).
member.param: Input object that is a scene graph root.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.EraseSceneGraphRoot(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable)
member.summary: Informs this Model that pRoot is no longer a scene graph root. This will cause the cache for pRoot to be destroyed if pRoot is not viewed by any View objects. If pRoot has been added to an View, it is implicitly registered as a scene graph root and will remain cached until it has been erased from all View objects. View.Erase() calls this method to ensure that pRoot is no longer implicitly registered as a scene graph root.
member.param: Input object that was a scene graph root.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.OnAdded(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable,Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable)
member.summary: This notification informs the Graphic System (GS) that the specified Drawable has been added to the database represented by this Model.
member.param: Input object that has been added to the database.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.OnModified(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable,Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable)
member.summary: This notification informs the Graphic System (GS) that the database representation of the specified Drawable has been modified. For maximum efficiency, this should be called only when the geometry, attributes, or child list of the Drawable is modified.
member.param: Input object that has been modified.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.OnErased(Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable,Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsInterface.Drawable)
member.summary: This notification informs the Graphic System (GS) that the specified Drawable has been removed from the underlying database; it offers the GS the opportunity to clean up the portion of its cache corresponding to the erase database object.
member.param: Input object that has been removed from the database.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.OnPaletteModified
member.summary: This notification informs the GS that the color palette has changed.

member.summary: Returns whatever base modeling transformation has been set (or identity if none has been set) via setTransform.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.ViewClippingOverride
member.summary: Pass true to this method to enable the geometry in a model to ignore the views front and back clipping planes (if any). Pass false to this method to ensure that a model respects the views clipping planes (this is the default behavior).

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.VisualStyleId
member.summary: Returns the persistent visual style on the model.By default, the view displays models in the visual style assigned to the view. Use this method to direct views to display the model in the specified visual style. Subsequent changes to VisualStyle will automatically reflect in the view. Specify ObjectId.kNull to clear the visual style on the model and revert to displaying with the view visual style.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.VisualStyle
member.summary: Returns the non-persistent visual style on the model.By default, the view displays models in the visual style assigned to the view. Use this method to direct views to display the model in the specified visual style. The view makes a copy of the passed in visual style, so call this method every time the VisualStyle is changed and the model display needs to be updated.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Model.BackgroundId
member.summary: Returns the object ID of the Background-derived object on the view, if one is set. If no background was set, it returns ObjectId.kNull.

member.summary: Returns true if linetypes are currently enabled. Otherwise, returns false.

member.summary: Returns the visual style to be used for objects on the clipped side of the sectioning. Passing a null object ID indicates that the clipped side should not be drawn. The default style is null.

member.summary: Returns true if dynamic tessellation is enabled; it returns alse if dynamic tesselation is disabled.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.MaxLODs
member.summary: Returns an integer between 1 and 10, representing the number of tessellations that the Graphics System will cache for dynamic tessellation.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.SurfaceTessellationTolerance
member.summary: Retrieves the amount of detail (tessellation lines or triangles) displayed for surfaces.The return value is an integer between 0 and 100. The lower the integer value, the less detail.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.CurveTessellationTolerance
member.summary: Retrieves the amount of detail (tessellation lines or triangles) displayed for curves.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.FrameRate
member.summary: Returns an integer between 1 and 60, representing the display speed in frames per second that must be maintained during view manipulations for adaptive degradation mode.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.AdaptiveDegradation
member.summary: Returns true if adaptive degradation is enabled; it false if adaptive generation is disabled.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.RedrawOnWindowExpose
member.summary: Returns true if geometry is re-rasterized before the screen is updated; it returns false if geometry is not re-rasterized.

member.summary: Retrieves the currently configured handedness of the data passed in to the GS.

member.name: P:Autodesk.AutoCAD.GraphicsSystem.Configuration.DiscardBackFaces
member.summary: Returns true if back faces are discarded; it returns false if they are drawn.

member.name: T:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ComponentModel.IPropertyProvider
member.summary: Provides access to optional or "per-instance" properties. Objects that implement this interface can be used by the TypeDescriptor class to provide access to per-instance properties. The system will automatically call the GetProperties method if the Provider has been added to the TypeDescriptor either via the PropertyProviderAttribute or at runtime via TypeDescriptor.AddPropertyProvider.

member.name: M:Autodesk.AutoCAD.ComponentModel.IPropertyProvider.GetProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a collection of PropertyDescriptor objects based on a given object instance. The returned PropertyDescriptors may vary from instance to instance.
member.param: Input the instance to retrieve from
